overview_summary: The neighbors include a major food distribution facility (formerly Sara Lee, now operated by Tyson Foods), the county's economic development corporation (SEDCO), and a leading local coal company (Reading Anthracite) with substantial land holdings. SEDCO and Reading Anthracite wield particularly strong influence: SEDCO coordinates industrial projects and public incentives, while Reading Anthracite controls vast tracts of land and is branching into real estate development. Reading Anthracite could become a competitor or opposition funder if a project conflicts with its plans, whereas SEDCO is likely to support developments that promise jobs and tax revenue; the Tyson/Sara Lee facility is a significant employer but generally neutral unless its operations are affected.

neighbors.name: Sara Lee Corp
neighbors.claims: Sara Lee Corp established a food distribution center in the Highridge Business Park (Cass Township) around 2007 [Pottsville Republican-Herald](https://republicanherald4.rssing.com/chan-15221936/all_p932.html). The facility is now run by Tyson Foods (which acquired Sara Lee's meat business) and was expanded in 2018 with a 164,000 sq ft addition and state economic incentives, adding 114 jobs [Pottsville Republican-Herald](https://republicanherald4.rssing.com/chan-15221936/all_p866.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major employer (~200 jobs); part of Tyson Foods; key logistics hub in region

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Tyson Foods' site management to ensure the project doesn't disrupt their distribution operations; emphasize mutual benefits to maintain a neutral stance.

neighbors.name: Schuylkill Economic Dev Corp
neighbors.claims: Schuylkill Economic Development Corp (SEDCO) is a nonprofit civic organization (501(c)(4)) founded in 1952 to spur industrial development in Schuylkill County, including developing industrial parks, constructing speculative 'shell' buildings and offering low-interest financing to attract employers [Cause IQ](https://www.causeiq.com/organizations/schuylkill-economic-development-corporation,231412034/). SEDCO also operates the 2,000-acre Highridge Business Park (spanning Cass, Foster and Butler townships), which hosts major distribution centers (e.g. Lowe's, Wegmans) and still has hundreds of acres available for new projects [Foster Township](https://www.fostertwp.org/area-overview/economic-development/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Primary development authority; manages large industrial parks; strong ties to local government and business leaders

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage SEDCO President Frank Zukas early to align the project with their development mission; highlight local job creation and tax revenue to secure SEDCO's support.

neighbors.name: Reading Anthracite Co
neighbors.claims: Reading Anthracite Company is a Pottsville-based coal mining firm and part of the Rich family's privately held group of companies [SourceWatch](https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Reading_Anthracite_Company). The company owns extensive coal lands in the region, including a 1,525-acre tract in Schuylkill Township where it sought approval to install a 5-acre solar panel array in 2023 [Times News](https://www.tnonline.com/20230918/solar-park-proposed-in-schuylkill/). In late 2023, Reading Anthracite unveiled plans to construct six large warehouses (800,000-1,600,000 sq ft each) on a 600-acre parcel near I-81, directly across from the Highridge industrial park [Yahoo News](https://www.yahoo.com/news/reading-anthracite-plans-warehouse-development-035900470.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls thousands of acres; legacy coal industry leader; significant capital for development

approach_recommendations.engage: Open direct dialogue with Reading Anthracite President Brian Rich Sr.; address potential conflicts with their development plans by exploring partnership or shared infrastructure to avoid opposition.
